message:
So it seems the incoming dash update might not contain many — or any — user-facing changes, but it'll nonetheless be one of the most far-reaching updates yet:

http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/digitalfoundry-new-xbox-dash-doesnt-work-on-all-drives

It'll be the first dash update to rewrite the firmware of the DVD drive itself (thereby incidentally also un-hacking any hacked consoles) and will enable the new disc formate with an additional GB of storage.

Crucially, it appears that it won't work on all consoles (!!)  Apparently a "small percentage" (probably those with a certain make of optical drive) will be incompatible, and won't be able to play commercial games after the update.  If this happens to you, Microsoft will give you a brand new 250GB slim.  So, um, yes… they seem pretty heavily invested in this update.
I like that it's bringing PayPal support. A minor convenience, sure, but convenient enough for me.

Err, if you're on an SA account, then NO PAYPAL FOR YOU.

http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-05-19-the-xbox-live-regions-not-getting-paypal

Also, I read last night that the incompatible Xboxen would already have stopped working after the preparatory dash update earlier this year.  So no sitting around hoping your Xbox dies so you can claim a new one — if it was going to die it would already have done so.

(Mind you, I haven't fired up a commercial game on my bedroom Xbox in months…)
I wonder if they'll allow you to use a SA Paypal account on a UK Live account, or block it like iTunes does.
I'll give it a bash over the weekend, if the update gets rolled out to my console.
My console has still not updated. Is this normal?

Apparently they're rolling it out in phases up until … the end of the month, I think(?)

Neither of my Xboxen have updated yet.
Well well well. I added my Paypal account to my UK Xbox account, and bought some points, without any hassles whatsoever. This is excellent!
Excellent news! That'll make things a lot easier.
